title: How to Block People on YouTube: 3 Easy Options

steps.title: Go to YouTube Studio.
steps.content: Go to YouTube Studio. It's where you can manage your videos. If you're using a web browser on a computer, log into YouTube, click your profile picture, and select YouTube Studio . If you're using Android, iPhone, or iPad, open the YouTube Studio app. This action prevents others from seeing the blocked user's comments on your videos. Hiding does not prevent that user from seeing public videos on your channel.

steps.title: Click Comments.
steps.content: Click Comments . On a computer, you'll see a section on your dashboard titled "Recent Comments," but you can click the "Comments" link in the menu on the left side to see more comments. On the mobile app, you'll see "Comments" with an icon of a comment bubble near the bottom of your screen.

steps.title: Click or tap ⁝ next to the user that you want to block.
steps.content: Click or tap ⁝ next to the user that you want to block. You'll see this three-dot menu icon to the right of their comment.

steps.title: Click or tap Hide user from channel.
steps.content: Click or tap Hide user from channel . Although that user will remain on your subscriber list, anyone who views your channel will not see the comments that this user leaves. If you want to unhide those users, go to YouTube Studio, then go to Settings > Community and click the x next to their username in the "Hidden Users" section. You can also block a channel by going to their page on YouTube, or in the YouTube app, and in the three-dot menu, selecting Hide user from my channel .

steps.title: They cannot create clips from your videos or live streams.
steps.content: They cannot create clips from your videos or live streams. While they can still see content that is public, they won't be able to use YouTube's technology to capture clips from your videos and streams. [1] X Research source YouTube changed the wording from "Block user" to "Hide user from my channel." However, you can block live comments as a viewer and creator .

steps.title: They won't be notified.
steps.content: They won't be notified. Hiding a user will not send them a notification, and they will not be able to see videos that you upload and mark as private.

steps.title: They won't be able to comment on your videos.
steps.content: They won't be able to comment on your videos. Although they can see any public videos, any comment they make will not be posted. If they do get posted, they will be removed within 48 hours!

steps.title: Open YouTube on your computer, phone, or tablet and watch a Live.
steps.content: Open YouTube on your computer, phone, or tablet and watch a Live. You can block users whether you're using a computer, phone, or tablet. [2] X Research source Doing this will only block that user during the Live . If you want to block them for good, block them from your channel .

steps.title: Tap the message from the user you want to block.
steps.content: Tap the message from the user you want to block. If you're on a computer, hover your mouse over the message and click the three-dot menu icon.

steps.title: Click or tap Block.
steps.content: Click or tap Block . This will hide that person's comments from you and also hide your comments from them in that live chat. To unblock, go to https://myaccount.google.com/blocklist and click or tap the x icon next to their name.

steps.title: Sign into YouTube Studio or Live Control Room.
steps.content: Sign into YouTube Studio or Live Control Room. Use this method if you're hosting a Live video and want to block someone in the chat. If you have a video that's set to premier at a specific time, you can moderate and limit the live chat. You can also moderate the chat on a Live video in the Live Control Room, which you see if you tap Edit as you're streaming.

steps.title: Click Content.
steps.content: Click Content . You'll see it in the menu on the left side of your screen.

steps.title: Click .
steps.content: Click . It's the pencil-looking icon below the live video you're about to show.

steps.title: Click See More.
steps.content: Click See More . This is at the bottom of the page and will reveal more options.

steps.title: Choose who can send messages.
steps.content: Choose who can send messages. You can set this so only subscribers or members can chat. You can also specify which YouTube users you want to approve. In that case, tap Edit and select Approved Users .

steps.title: Delete messages during a live chat.
steps.content: Delete messages during a live chat. On a computer, press Alt/Opt to pause the chat. Select the three-dot menu and select Delete , Place the user in time out , or Hide the user from the chat message feed or comments section on your channel. [3] X Research source
